Field.Description: The node is in the process of powering down and not capable of running any jobs.
The node is in the process of being powered up.
https://slurm.schedmd.com/sinfo.html#SECTION_NODE-STATE-CODES
The node is in an advanced reservation and not generally available.
The node is currently allocated a job, but will not be allocated additional jobs. The node state will be changed to state DRAINED when the last job on it completes.

The node is expected to fail soon and is unavailable for use per system administrator request. See the update node command in the scontrol(1) man page or the slurm.conf(5) man page for more information.
The Slurm controller has just started and the node's state has not yet been determined.
The node has been allocated to one or more jobs.
The node is currently executing a job, but is expected to fail soon and is unavailable for use per system administrator request.
SLURM Multi Category Security label. see https://slurm.schedmd.com/
The node is allocated to one or more active jobs plus one or more jobs are in the process of COMPLETING.
The node has been blocked by exclusive topo job.
Network Performance Counters associated with this node are in use,rendering this node as not usable for any other jobs
The node is planned by the backfill scheduler for a higher priority job.
The node is pending power down.
The node is currently powered down and not capable of running any jobs.
Scheduling weight of the nodes.
The node is currently not fully configured,but expected to be available at some point in the indefinite future for use.
The node is not allocated to any jobs and is available for use.
Features available on the nodes. Also see features_act.
SLURM Multi Category Security label. see https://slurm.schedmd.com/

The node did not register correctly with the controller. This happens when a node registers with less resources than configured in the slurm.conf file. The node will clear from this state with a valid registrat
SLURM Multi Category Security label. see https://slurm.schedmd.com/
The node is currently in a reservation with a flag value of maintenance.
SLURM Multi Category Security label. see https://slurm.schedmd.com/
A reboot request has been sent to the agent configured to handle this request.
A request to reboot this node has been made,but hasn't been handled yet.
The node has some of its CPUs ALLOCATED while others are IDLE. Or the node has a suspended job allocated to some of its TRES (e.g. memory).

All jobs associated with this node are in the process of COMPLETING. This node state will be removed when all of the job's processes have terminated and the Slurm epilog program (if any) has terminated.
The node is unavailable for use. Slurm can automatically place nodes in this state if some failure occurs. System administrators may also explicitly place nodes in this state.
The node is unavailable for use per system administrator request. See the update node command in the scontrol(1) man page or the slurm.conf(5) man page for more information.
SLURM Multi Category Security label. see https://slurm.schedmd.com/
CPU Usage number
SLURM cores per socket

Tag.Name: #node_not_available
Tag.Description: SLURM Node not available due to various reasons

Parser.Name: Copy of scontrol nodes file
